meanings.definition: To move one's finger across a touchscreen in order to navigate or interact with a device.
meanings.sent1: I swipe my finger on the phone to answer calls.
meanings.sent2: She likes to swipe through photos on her tablet.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to swipe at the moving cursor on the screen.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to swipe the leaves off the tree branches.
meanings.sent5: Remember to swipe gently to scroll down the page.

meanings.definition: To steal or take something quickly and often without permission.
meanings.sent1: He tried to swipe a cookie from the jar when no one was looking.
meanings.sent2: The pickpocket attempted to swipe the wallet from the distracted tourist.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel managed to swipe a peanut from the picnic basket.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to swipe the watch right off the volunteer's wrist.
meanings.sent5: Thieves often swipe valuables from unlocked cars.

meanings.definition: A quick, forceful stroke or blow.
meanings.sent1: With a swift swipe, he knocked the ball out of the opponent's hand.
meanings.sent2: The chef used a precise swipe of the knife to slice the vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy gave a playful swipe with its paw at the toy.
meanings.sent4: The storm brought a powerful swipe of wind that knocked down trees.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush made a bold swipe of color across the canvas.
